title: cuDNN launch failure with Windows 10
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.2b6 Anaconda env used: DLC-GPU **Describe the problem** Hello! Thank you so much for this amazing tool. I'm trying to get DLC-GPU to work on my Windows 10 system. I'm using the GUI, and I was able to extract frames, label and create a training set. But I get a cuDNN launch failure error when I try to train the network. I'm using the default settings under the network training tab. Here's more information: **`nvidia-smi` in cmd tells me that:** _NVIDIA Graphics Card_: Quadro RTX 3000 _NVIDIA driver version_: 442.83 _CUDA version_: 10.2 **`nvcc --version` says** _CUDA version_: 10.0.130 NOTE: I wasn't able to uninstall the original CUDA version that my laptop came with through control panel because it wasn't on the list of installed programs. I was hoping the installer for version 10.0 would overwrite the original version (v10.2). I'm not sure what actually happened because `nvidia-smi` and `nvcc--version` tell me different things about what version of CUDA I have on my system. Hopefully, the problem is not that I have a LOT of labels. I have 27 static labels, in addition to 7 labels for the animal.
Code output

```python In [12]: import deeplabcut In [13]: deeplabcut.launch_dlc() note to user: currently only ResNet50-v1 is available for maDLC note to user: currently model comparison is not available in maDLC
